TLINE.TDLINE: This document outlines the process for assigning Model Key to a team and
managing detailed tool usage statistics for Genie.
Assigning Model Keys:
Generate Model Key: Follow the instructions in the Google Cloud document
referenced in the link provided to generate a unique Model Key for the
team.
https://cloud.google.com/solutions/sap/docs/abap-sdk/on-premises-or-any-
cloud/latest/authentication
For best results with the provided prompts, we recommend using the
gemini-1.5-flash-002 model. Other models may require prompt adjustments.
Assign Model Key to Team: Assign the generated Model Key to the newly
created team.
Detailed Tool Usage Statistics:
By default, Genie captures the detailed tool usage statistics including
User ID
Feature used
Timestamp
Object Package and Name
Prompt passed to the mode
Code sent to the model and code lines count
Response received from the model
This detailed information is useful for monitoring and analyzing usage
patterns, identifying potential issues, and ensuring compliance with
organizational policies.
Disabling Detailed Usage Statistics:
If detailed usage statistics do not align with your organization's
policies, you can disable this feature. Disabling detailed usage
statistics will exclude user id, prompts, code, and model responses from
logging.
Enabling/Disabling Specific Features:
The authorization object ZCA_GENIE includes two fields:
Team Name: ZGN_TEAM
Feature: ZGN_FEATUR
Once a team is configured under 'Configure New Team for Authorization
Control', the security team can assign the ZCA_GENIE authorization
object to the team's unique role. By selecting the team name in
ZGN_TEAM and specifying the desired features in ZGN_FEATUR, you can
enable or disable specific AI features for that team.
